Afghanistan.fact: Afghanistan is home to part of the ancient Silk Road and contains high mountain ranges like the Hindu Kush.

Albania.fact: Albania has an extensive coastline along the Adriatic and Ionian Seas and many well-preserved Byzantine sites.

Algeria.bird: Fennec Fox (national animal) — Commonly associated; national bird often cited as the North African ostrich
Algeria.fact: Algeria is the largest country in Africa by land area and contains large portions of the Sahara Desert.

Andorra.fact: Andorra is a small, mountainous country in the Pyrenees between France and Spain and is famous for its ski resorts.

Angola.fact: Angola has diverse landscapes from Atlantic coastline to highlands and large national parks like Kissama National Park.

Antigua and Barbuda.bird: Antiguan Racer (actually a snake) — common national animal; national bird often cited as the frigatebird
Antigua and Barbuda.fact: Antigua has 365 beaches—one for each day of the year—making it a popular Caribbean destination.

Argentina.fact: Argentina is the largest Spanish-speaking country by land area and home to diverse regions from Patagonia to Iguazú Falls.

Armenia.fact: Armenia is one of the oldest Christian civilizations and home to ancient monasteries like Geghard and Tatev.

Australia.fact: Australia is a continent-country with unique wildlife—over 80% of its mammals and reptiles are endemic.

Austria.bird: Lammergeier / Bearded Vulture (symbolic in alpine regions)
Austria.fact: Austria is renowned for its musical heritage (Mozart, Strauss) and alpine scenery with historic cities like Vienna and Salzburg.

Azerbaijan.fact: Azerbaijan stretches from the Caspian Sea to the Caucasus mountains and is known for its oil reserves and 'flame' motifs.

Bahamas.fact: The Bahamas is an archipelago of over 700 islands and is known for blue holes and clear turquoise waters.

Bahrain.fact: Bahrain is an island nation in the Persian Gulf, historically an important trading and pearling center.

Bangladesh.fact: Bangladesh has one of the world's largest river deltas and the Sundarbans, the world's largest mangrove forest home to Bengal tigers.

Barbados.fact: Barbados is a Caribbean island nation with a strong cultural heritage and Bridgetown is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Belarus.fact: Belarus features vast forests and lakes; Mir and Nesvizh castles are UNESCO-listed historical sites.

Belgium.bird: Black Woodpecker (symbolic); national bird commonly cited as the Common Blackbird
Belgium.fact: Belgium hosts many international institutions and is famous for chocolate, waffles, and historic cities like Bruges and Brussels.

Belize.fact: Belize has the second largest barrier reef in the world and extensive Mayan ruins inland.

Benin.fact: Benin was the birthplace of the historical Kingdom of Dahomey and is an important West African cultural center.

Bhutan.bird: Ruddy Shelduck (symbolic); Black-necked Crane (important in highlands)
Bhutan.fact: Bhutan measures prosperity by Gross National Happiness and maintains a strong commitment to preserving its culture and environment.

Bolivia.fact: Bolivia includes diverse landscapes from the Andes to the Amazon and contains Lake Titicaca, the highest navigable lake.

Bosnia and Herzegovina.fact: Bosnia and Herzegovina features Ottoman and Austro-Hungarian heritage seen in cities like Sarajevo and Mostar.

Botswana.fact: Botswana is home to the Okavango Delta, one of the world's largest inland deltas and a wildlife-rich wilderness.

Brazil.fact: Brazil contains much of the Amazon rainforest and is the largest country in South America by area and population.

Brunei.fact: Brunei is a small, wealthy sultanate on Borneo known for oil and gas wealth and preserved rainforests.

Bulgaria.fact: Bulgaria has ancient Thracian heritage and the Rila Monastery, and is known for its rose valley and Balkans mountains.

Burkina Faso.fact: Burkina Faso is a landlocked West African country known for its music, arts festivals, and Sahelian landscapes.

Burundi.bird: Shoebill (in regional wetlands) — commonly noted in Great Lakes region
Burundi.fact: Burundi is a small East African country in the African Great Lakes region with rich cultural traditions.

Cabo Verde.fact: Cabo Verde (Cape Verde) is an island nation off the West African coast known for Creole Portuguese-African culture and music.

Cambodia.fact: Cambodia is home to the Angkor Wat temple complex, one of the world's largest religious monuments.

Cameroon.bird: Fountain Warbler (symbolic) / African grey parrot in region
Cameroon.fact: Cameroon is sometimes called 'Africa in miniature' due to its geological and cultural diversity.

Canada.bird: Gray Jay (Canada Jay) — often used as a national bird; officially the gray jay
Canada.fact: Canada has the longest coastline in the world and vast boreal forests stretching across the country.

Central African Republic.fact: The Central African Republic includes dense rainforest regions and important wildlife habitats in Central Africa.

Chad.bird: Sociable Lapwing (regionally observed) / Ostrich species historic
Chad.fact: Chad contains part of the Sahara Desert in the north and the productive Lake Chad basin in the southwest.

Chile.fact: Chile is a very long, narrow country stretching from the dry Atacama Desert to the glaciers of Patagonia.

China.fact: China is the world's most populous country and home to a wide range of landscapes from deserts to mountains and river valleys.

Colombia.bird: Andean Cock-of-the-rock (national bird for Andean region) / Andean condor also important
Colombia.fact: Colombia is one of the most biodiverse countries in the world per square kilometer and hosts part of the Amazon rainforest.

Comoros.fact: Comoros is an archipelago in the Indian Ocean with volcanic islands and strong Swahili-influenced culture.

Congo (Republic of the Congo).fact: The Republic of the Congo contains extensive tropical rainforest and is part of the Congo Basin.

Congo (Democratic Republic of the Congo).bird: Okapi (national mammal), regional birds include African grey parrot — exceptional biodiversity
Congo (Democratic Republic of the Congo).fact: DR Congo is one of Africa's largest countries and contains large portions of the Congo rainforest, an incredibly biodiverse region.

Costa Rica.fact: Costa Rica is famed for its biodiversity and pioneering conservation efforts, protecting about a quarter of its land as reserves.

Côte d'Ivoire.fact: Also known as Ivory Coast, the country is a leading producer of cocoa and has diverse forests and savannahs.

Croatia.fact: Croatia has a long Adriatic coastline with many islands and historic cities like Dubrovnik with well-preserved medieval walls.

Cuba.fact: Cuba is the largest island nation in the Caribbean and has a rich musical and revolutionary history.

Cyprus.fact: Cyprus is a Mediterranean island with ancient history and mixed Greek and Turkish cultural influences.

Czech Republic.fact: The Czech Republic is known for its historic architecture, castles, and beer-brewing tradition (Czech pilsner).

Denmark.fact: Denmark is part of the Scandinavian region and is known for design, high quality of life, and historic Copenhagen.

Djibouti.fact: Djibouti sits at the entrance to the Red Sea and is strategically located near key shipping lanes.

Dominica.fact: Dominica is known as the 'Nature Island' of the Caribbean with volcanic landscapes and abundant rainforests.

Dominican Republic.fact: The Dominican Republic shares the island of Hispaniola with Haiti and has a rich colonial history and beaches.
